instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.P3V3S0_EN: What is P3V3S0_EN? This signal enables the PP3V3_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Hello,

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that initially had short on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>. removed the damaged cap <CAPACITOR>C1008</CAPACITOR> near the cpu without heat.
no more shorts but still does not boot.
i detected pulsing voltage when plugin in magsafe from s4 all the way to <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWGD</SIGNAL>. no other shorts found so far.
any suggestions on troubleshooting steps to continue ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Post actual resistance to ground at L7310/20.
Any history fault, liquid signs?

Stable <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
resistace to gnd on L7310/20 is 42ohms

only liquid signs on <CAPACITOR>C1801</CAPACITOR>(removed) and <TRANSISTOR>Q1840</TRANSISTOR>(replaced)

and yes stable <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Do you note any pulse at <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> too?
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
There is a pulse there and at VCORE as well..
same dead on SMC bypass

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Any pulse at <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>?
If not check pin 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
can't find <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>, hopefully <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_BUF_L</SIGNAL> is the same.. and no pulse here
and nothing on pin 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> either

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
***you can ignore this***
i'm measuring <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> @ 1.9V. is this right? i'm not even getting <SIGNAL>P3V3S0_EN</SIGNAL> always on how is there even voltage here @@?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Yeah, is <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> in fact.

Check for pulse at pins 7, 5, 6, 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.
Inspect its area for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: no corrosion in the area, no pulse on pin 3,6. pulses on pin 5,7 on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: Tie together pins 5 & 6, then check pin 3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: now i get a pulse on pin 3, still not turning on. whats next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> pulses now?
Try SMC bypass again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: Yes  <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  pulses now but still no boot, Fan does not even attempt to spin with SMC bypass

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Termination resistors and traces.
Clean J6100; remove, if needed.

You should have something more corroded.
Also possible to have accumulated crap underneath SMC, or CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message:
all SPI termination resisters and traces are in order.. no other corrosion seen from the original <CAPACITOR>C1801</CAPACITOR>(removed) and <TRANSISTOR>Q1840</TRANSISTOR>(replaced).

J6100 is removed and SMC already reballed. which only left CPU. dead CPU or just reflow?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing. not turning on
threads.message: Try heating CPU with quality flux; just to burn eventually accumulated crap.
